meanings.definition: The quality or state of being clannish
meanings.sent1: The clannishnesses of the family made outsiders feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: Her clannishnesses were evident in how she always stuck with her close group of friends.
meanings.sent3: The clannishnesses of the penguins at the zoo led to them forming a 'cool kids' club.
meanings.sent4: The clannishnesses of the wolves in the pack ensured their survival in the harsh winter.
meanings.sent5: The clannishnesses of the bees in the hive created a strong sense of unity and cooperation.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of forming exclusive groups or cliques
meanings.sent1: In high school, the clannishnesses among the students often caused conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The clannishnesses in the workplace made it hard for new employees to fit in.
meanings.sent3: The clannishnesses of the cats in the neighborhood led to them having secret meetings at night.
meanings.sent4: The clannishnesses of the birds in the forest resulted in different species sticking to their own groups.
meanings.sent5: The clannishnesses of the children on the playground sometimes excluded others from playing with them.

meanings.definition: The tendency to prioritize the interests of one's own group over others
meanings.sent1: His clannishnesses often made him overlook the needs of those outside his circle.
meanings.sent2: The clannishnesses of the team caused them to only socialize with each other after games.
meanings.sent3: The clannishnesses of the squirrels in the park led to them hoarding all the nuts for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The clannishnesses of the ants in the colony made them fiercely protect their queen from any threat.
meanings.sent5: The clannishnesses of the villagers made them suspicious of outsiders trying to join their community.
